home.title: Welcome to NUI
home.subtitle: A modern, customizable Angular component library
home.description: Build beautiful applications with our comprehensive set of UI components

installation.title: Installation
installation.subtitle: Get started with NUI in your Angular project
installation.step1Description: Use npm or yarn to install the NUI package in your project.
installation.step2Description: Configure NUI in your application config file. Define the preset you want to use and the theme mode.
installation.step3Description: You can import NUI styles in three different ways: in your global styles.scss file, in angular.json, or in project.json if you're using Nx.
installation.step4Description: You can now use any NUI component in your HTML templates.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.subtitle: Configure NUI to match your needs
configuration.presetConfigDescription: Presets define your application's color palette. NUI includes 8 pre-built presets: aura, warm, neon, dopamine, corporate, minimal, sunset, and ocean.
configuration.darkModeConfigDescription: Control how dark mode is applied in your application. Available options are: 'manual' (controlled by code), 'auto' (based on time of day), or 'system' (according to OS preferences).
configuration.customPresetConfigDescription: Create your own preset by defining custom colors for light and dark modes. Each preset must include: primary, secondary, accent, success, info, warning, and danger.

theming.title: Theming & Presets
theming.subtitle: Customize the look and feel of your application
theming.description: NUI comes with multiple pre-built presets. Each preset defines a unique color palette that can be applied to all components.

presetDescriptions.aura: Default modern and elegant palette with teal and purple tones
presetDescriptions.warm: Energetic palette with warm coral and golden tones, perfect for e-commerce
presetDescriptions.neon: Futuristic cyberpunk palette with electric cyan and neon colors, ideal for gaming
presetDescriptions.dopamine: Optimistic and cheerful palette with bright lime and pink tones
presetDescriptions.corporate: Professional blue palette, perfect for business and enterprise applications
presetDescriptions.minimal: Refined minimalist palette with subtle colors and elegant purple accent
presetDescriptions.sunset: Warm and vibrant palette with rose, pink and orange tones, perfect for creative apps
presetDescriptions.ocean: Calm and professional palette with deep blues and aqua tones, ideal for productivity

button.title: Button
button.subtitle: Versatile button component with multiple variants, sizes, and states

basic.title: Basic Button
basic.description: The simplest form of a button with default styling.

variants.title: Variants
variants.description: Buttons come in three variants: solid (default), outline, and ghost.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: Buttons support all theme colors: primary, secondary, accent, success, info, warning, and danger.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Five size options available: xs, sm, md (default), lg, and xl.

icons.title: With Icons
icons.description: Add icons to buttons at the start or end position. Buttons with only an icon are rendered as circular icon buttons.
icons.note: Icon position: 'start' displays the icon before text, 'end' displays it after. Icon-only buttons require the aria-label attribute for accessibility.

loading.title: Loading State
loading.description: Display a loading spinner in three positions: start, end, or center (which replaces the content).
loading.note: Loading positions: 'start' shows spinner before text, 'end' shows it after, 'center' replaces content entirely with centered spinner.

width.title: Width
width.description: Control button width: auto (default), full (100%), or fit (fit-content).
width.note: Width options: 'auto' adapts to content with standard padding, 'full' stretches to 100% of container, 'fit' uses minimum space needed.

disabled.title: Disabled State
disabled.description: Disabled buttons prevent user interaction and display a dimmed appearance.

events.title: Events
events.description: Handle click events with the onClick output. Supports button types: button, submit, and reset.
events.consoleNote: Open DevTools (F12) and check the Console tab to see the events being logged when you click the buttons.

directive.title: Using Directive
directive.description: Apply button styling to native HTML elements using the nuiButton directive. Works with <button> and <a> elements.
